com.crickettechnology.audio

Class EffectBus

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.crickettechnology.audio.EffectBus

  • public final class EffectBus
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages a set of audio effects applied to sounds.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • addEffect

        public void addEffect(Effect effect)
        Add an effect to this bus. An effect can only be on one bus at a time.

      • removeEffect

        public void removeEffect(Effect effect)
        Remove an effect from this bus.

      • removeAllEffects

        public void removeAllEffects()
        Remove all effects from this bus.

      • setOutputBus

        public void setOutputBus(EffectBus outputBus)
        Set the bus to which this bus's output is sent. If null (the default), the audio from this bus is mixed into the final output.

      • getOutputBus

        public EffectBus getOutputBus()
        Get the bus to which this bus's output is sent. If null (the default), the audio from this bus is mixed into the final output.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset the state of all effects on this bus.

      • setBypassed

        public void setBypassed(boolean bypassed)
        Set whether this bus is bypassed. A bypassed effect is not applied to the audio.

      • isBypassed

        public boolean isBypassed()
        Gets whether this bus is bypassed. Effects in a bypassed bus are not applied to the audio.

      • setWetDryRatio

        public void setWetDryRatio(float wetDry)
        Sets the wet/dry ratio for this bus. The ratio can range from 0 to 1. A value of 0 means the audio is left completely "dry", that is, with no effects applied; it is equivalent to bypassing the bus. A value of 1 means the audio is completely "wet", that is, the original "dry" signal is not mixed back into the processed audio.

      • getWetDryRatio

        public float getWetDryRatio()
        Gets the wet/dry ratio for this bus. The ratio can range from 0 to 1. A value of 0 means the audio is left completely "dry", that is, with no effects applied; it is equivalent to bypassing the bus. A value of 1 means the audio is completely "wet", that is, the original "dry" signal is not mixed back into the processed audio.

      • newEffectBus

        public static EffectBus newEffectBus()
        Create a new effect bus.

      • getGlobalEffectBus

        public static EffectBus getGlobalEffectBus()
        Get the global effect bus. Effects on this bus are applied to the final audio before it is output.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroy this object. This is called when the object is finalized by the garbage collector; however, it is better to call it explicitly, so the object is destroyed predictably.
